rfid.rfcode

Class HttpRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • rfid.rfcode.HttpRequest

  • public class HttpRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an HTTP request to be used to access the Zone Manager API.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpRequest(java.util.ArrayList<HttpParameter> params, java.lang.String command, java.lang.String host)
      Constructs the HTTPRequest object.
      HttpRequest(java.lang.String command, java.lang.String host)
      Constructs the HTTPRequest object without parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String execute()
      Executes this HTTP request.
      java.lang.String getCommand()
      Returns the command that this HTTP request will execute.
      java.lang.String getHost()
      Returns the hostname of the server this HTTP request targets.
      java.util.ArrayList<HttpParameter> getParams()
      Returns the list of parameters that this HTTP request uses.
      void setCommand(java.lang.String command)
      Sets the command that this HTTP request will execute.
      void setHost(java.lang.String host)
      Sets the hostname of the server this HTTP request will target.
      void setParams(java.util.ArrayList<HttpParameter> params)
      Sets the list of parameters that this HTTP request uses.

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(java.util.ArrayList<HttpParameter> params,
                   java.lang.String command,
                   java.lang.String host)
        Constructs the HTTPRequest object.
        Parameters:
        params - contains the parameters to be passed
        command - contains the command to be executed
        host - the hostname (IP address) of the target server
        See Also:
        HttpParameter

                   java.lang.String host)
        Constructs the HTTPRequest object without parameters.
        Parameters:

        host - the hostname (IP address) of the target server

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                java.net.ProtocolException
        Executes this HTTP request.
        Returns:
        the response by the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when a connection cannot be opened
        java.net.MalformedURLException - is thrown when the URL is invalid
        java.net.ProtocolException - is thrown when there is a connection protocol error

      • getCommand

        public java.lang.String getCommand()
        Returns the command that this HTTP request will execute.
        Returns:
        the command in question

      • setCommand

        public void setCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Sets the command that this HTTP request will execute.
        Parameters:
        command - the value to set the command to

      • getParams

        public java.util.ArrayList<HttpParameter> getParams()
        Returns the list of parameters that this HTTP request uses.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of references to HttpParameter objects

      • setParams

        public void setParams(java.util.ArrayList<HttpParameter> params)
        Sets the list of parameters that this HTTP request uses.
        Parameters:
        params - an ArrayList of HttpParameter objects

      • getHost

        public java.lang.String getHost()
        Returns the hostname of the server this HTTP request targets.
        Returns:
        the hostname (IP address) of the target server
